item.title: Carl Zimmer
item.description: On Wednesday the official number of cases in which cows gave people the flu rose to four. Today in my email newsletter, I look back at H5N1's evolutionary trail and imagine its possible paths from here. https://buttondown.email/carlzimmer/archive/fridays-elk-just-when-i-thought-i-was-out/

item.title: Spencer LaVere Smith
item.description:
Job ad for people who like working with multiphoton microscopes. Bruno is a brilliant scientist with a proven, solid business. For more information about INSS, visit www.inss.org.uk. To apply for this role please fill in the application
form at https://forms.gle/mnSXgaAnZvS5z2oKA and then upload your CV and cover letter in PDF
format to https://www.dropbox.com/request/LzjefmWwc0S1bfZP8y1KApplication Deadline: 31st July 2024Company: Independent NeuroScience Services INSS LtdLocation: Brighton, East Sussex, UK
INSS, a leading provider of custom two-photon microscopes for neuroscience research, is seeking a highly skilled Multiphoton Microscopy Expert to join our dynamic team. We offer unique "Assisted-DIY" solutions
for cost-efficient bespoke equipment, leveraging decades of experience in designing and building custom
equipment for neuroscience research.About the Role:
We are looking for an exceptionally knowledgeable and versatile professional to fill a multifaceted role as a high-end service & installation engineer who can also contribute to R&D, technical sales and quality control. This position offers an
exciting opportunity to work with cutting-edge technology and contribute to innovative neuroscience research worldwide.
The role requires regular physical presence at our Brighton location for building/testing/troubleshooting microscopes as well as frequent national and international travel for installation and service visits to our clients‚Äô labs.Key Responsibilities:
- Build, install, and troubleshoot multiphoton microscopes
- Travel internationally for on-site installations and service visits
- Contribute to design, implementation and quality control of custom-built microscopy solutionsRequired Qualifications:
- PhD in a relevant discipline (neuroscience, biomedical engineering, optical physics, etc.)
- Technical/analytical/detail-oriented mindset
- Hands-on experience with building and troubleshooting multiphoton microscopes
- Proficiency with ScanImage software
- Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal
- Willingness to travel internationally frequentlyDesired Qualifications:
- Hands-on experience with in vivo neuroscience experiments in rodents, zebrafish, drosophila, or other model organisms
- Programming skills in Matlab, Python, LabVIEW, or similar languages
- Prior industry experience
- Optical design experience with Zemax
- Experience with CAD design software (e.g., Solidworks, Autodesk Inventor)Why Join INSS?
At INSS, you'll be part of a small team dedicated to advancing neuroscience research through innovative microscopy solutions. We offer the opportunity to work with state-of-the-art technology, collaborate with leading researchers, and contribute to ground-breaking scientific discoveries. Join us in our mission to provide researchers with the tools they need to push the boundaries of neuroscience.
We offer a competitive salary commensurate with experience and qualifications. Benefits include private medical insurance
and death in service insurance.
INSS is an equal opportunity employer and values diversity in our workforce.
